org.cyclops.cyclopscore.config.extendedconfig

Class ExtendedConfig<C extends ExtendedConfig<C>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cyclops.cyclopscore.config.extendedconfig.ExtendedConfig<C>
  • Type Parameters:
    C - Class of the extension of ExtendedConfig
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<ExtendedConfig<C>>, IInitListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BiomeConfig, BlockConfig, CapabilityConfig, DummyConfig, EnchantmentConfig, EntityConfig, FluidConfig, ItemConfig, MobConfig, PotionConfig, VillagerConfig

    public abstract class ExtendedConfig<C extends ExtendedConfig<C>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<ExtendedConfig<C>>, IInitListener
    A config that refers to a IConfigurable. Every unique IConfigurable must have one unique extension of this class. This contains several configurable settings and properties that can also be set in the config file.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.cyclops.cyclopscore.init.IInitListener

        IInitListener.Step

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExtendedConfig

        public ExtendedConfig(ModBase mod,
                      boolean enabled,
                      java.lang.String namedId,
                      java.lang.String comment,
                      java.lang.Class<?> element)
        Create a new config
        Parameters:
        mod - The mod instance.
        enabled - If this should is enabled by default. If this is false, this can still be enabled through the config file.
        namedId - a unique name id
        comment - a comment that can be added to the config file line
        element - the class for the element this config is for

      • initSubInstance

        protected IConfigurable<C> initSubInstance()
        This method will by default just return null. If it returns something else, this config will assume that the object that is returned is the unique sub-instance for the configurable. This is only called once.
        Returns:
        A sub-instance that will become a singleton.

      • getSubInstance

        Returns:

      • isHardDisabled

        public boolean isHardDisabled()
        If the target should be hard-disabled, this means no occurence in the config file, total ignorance.
        Returns:
        if the target should run trough the config handler.

      • isDisableable

        public boolean isDisableable()
        Override this method to prevent configs to be disabled from the config file. (non-zero id's that is)
        Returns:
        if the target can be disabled.
